      Sign an array of bytes using a SoftCert
      byte[] sign(java.security.PrivateKey key, java.security.cert.X509Certificate certificate, byte[] data, boolean encapsulate)
      Sign using a private key and representative public keys to be added to the signed text
      VerifiedText verify(SignedText text, PlainText originalText)
      Verifies a signed text, if the signedText has it's own crl will verifies over it, if not it verifies over the CRL of SoftCert Object As for Issuers it will verifys to all issuers inside of signedText and SoftCert, if the text is signed with even only one trusted issuer it can be verified

      • sign

        public byte[] sign(java.security.PrivateKey privateKey,
                   java.util.List<java.security.cert.X509Certificate> certificate,
                   byte[] data,
                   boolean encapsulate)
            throws GbayCryptoException
        Sign an array of bytes using a SoftCert

        it Generates a Signed Data which can be carrying a detached CMS signature, or have encapsulated data, depending on the value of the encapsulated parameter.

        Parameters:
        privateKey -
        certificate - list of java X509Certificate that will be added as signers
        data -
        encapsulate - true if the content should be encapsulated in the signature, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        byte array of signed value
        Throws:
        GbayCryptoException

      • sign

        public byte[] sign(java.security.PrivateKey key,

            throws GbayCryptoException
        Sign using a private key and representative public keys to be added to the signed text
        Parameters:

        certificate -
        data -
        encapsulate -
        Returns:
        Throws:

      • verify

        public VerifiedText verify(SignedText text,
                           PlainText originalText)
                    throws GbayCryptoException
        Verifies a signed text, if the signedText has it's own crl will verifies over it, if not it verifies over the CRL of SoftCert Object As for Issuers it will verifys to all issuers inside of signedText and SoftCert, if the text is signed with even only one trusted issuer it can be verified
        Specified by:
        verify  in interface  CryptoServiceProvider
        Throws:
        GbayCryptoException

      • isRevoked

        public boolean isRevoked()
                  throws GbayCryptoException
        Check if cert is revoked, if you set certrepos URL to null and retry counts to -1 it will use default values in configuration
        Parameters:
        certRepos - URL address of cert Repos
        maxRetryRepos - Maximum retrying of getting CRL from cert repos
        maxRetryCDP - Maximum retrying of getting CRL from CDP in cert file
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - CRL is not readable
        java.security.cert.CertificateException
        GbayCryptoException
